content.description: A particle moves along the x-axis so that its velocity v at time t ≥ 0 is given by v(t) = sin(t2). The graph of v is shown above for \(0\le t\le\sqrt{5\pi}\). The position of the particle at time t is x(t) and its position at time t = 0 is x(0) = 5.
content.question: Find the total distance traveled by the particle from time t=0 to t=3.

frqParts.text: Find the total distance traveled by the particle from time t=0 to t=3.

topic.text: 8.2: Connecting Position, Velocity, and Acceleration Functions Using Integrals

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
